required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of High Energy Acoustic Shock Wave Therapy on Local Skin Perfusion and DFUs
clinical_study.official_title: A Post-market Pilot Study to Evaluate the Effects of High Energy Acoustic Shock Wave Therapy on Local Skin Perfusion and Healing of Diabetic Foot Ulcers

brief_summary.textblock: This is an observational, single-arm study. This clinical study will be conducted at up to 4 sites with a total of 10 subjects per site. All subjects will receive standard of care treatment which includes DFU treatments with the dermaPACE device.

detailed_description.textblock: The dermaPACE system will be used according to label along with standard of care. perfusion will be measured using TcPO2 methods and also using cleared hyperspectral imaging equipment. The intent of the study is to observe/measure oxygen saturation levels in the area of the treated wound before initiation of dermaPACE treatment, during the treatment period, and two weeks post treatment period

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Pulsed acoustic wave application on acute and chronic defects of the skin and subcutaneous soft tissues

primary_outcome.measure: Skin perfusion, effect on oxygenation level, by visit
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of changes in oxygenation levels in superficial tissue before and after treatment with dermaPACE System.

secondary_outcome.measure: Wound healing, effect on wound area, by visit
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of changes in wound area at each visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Wound healing, effect on wound closure, by visit
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of the rate of wound closure at each visit

arm_group.description: Non-sterile, single, Benchtop System that is comprised of a dermaPACE Control Console, PACE Applicator and foot pedal. The PACE applicator uses shockwave technology on acute and chronic defects.
